roleset.name: to become known
roleset.note: DAWN-V NOTES: Frames file for 'dawn' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from dawn.01-v)

example.name: both arguments
example.text: It [*EXP*-1] suddenly dawns on Mr. Hammack that [*]rebuilding the house in Los Gatos , an affluent community in Santa Clara County , may cost more than Aetna 's policy will pay [*?*] .
example.arg: that [*] rebuilding the house in Los Gatos , an affluent community in Santa Clara County , may cost more than Aetna 's policy will pay [*?*]

roleset.name: to begin to become light in the morning, an opening time period
roleset.note: DAWN-N NOTES: Added due to expansion of Nombank. Comparison to 'dawn.02-v'. Vn class appear-48.1.1. Framed by Katie. (from dawn.01-n)

example.name: intransitive
example.text: With a new day dawning on the sport , Mr. Jones does n't see a place for this sort of luxury .

example.name: new begining
example.text: The dawn of the twenty-first century

example.name: metaphorical new day
example.text: The dawn of a new era

example.name: When not to use arg 1
example.text: At dawn on a cool day
